Solving Addition Equations Learning Point 2 Solve an equation of the form x + a = b. Example 1 Concepts 2-3
Solve the equation x + 3 = 7 and check your answer.
Solution
x + 3 = 7 x +
x + 3 - 3 = 7 - 3
x x + (3 - 3) = (7 - 3)
x + 0 = 4
x x = 4
Check: 4 + 3 = 7 
Subtracting the same number from both sides of an equation produces an equation whose solution is the same as that of the original one.
Activity 2
Solve and check your answer. a) x + 8 = 20 b) y + 15 = 35 c) 7 + n = 16
A shortcut for solving an addition equation is to move the addend to the other side and to reverse the addition operation to a subtraction operation.
x + 4 = 9 7 + y = 11 Recall that addition is commutative: x + 4 = 9 - 4 7 + y = 11 - 7 7 + y = 11 is the same as y + 7 = 11. x = 5 y = 4
